comments.body: Scratch all of the above; that's just the codesandbox console not printing the `@@toStringTag` or constructor name for instances. That's no ordinary object, it's an instance of the [`Text` DOM constructor](https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#interface-text).
You should add type `Text` declaration first.

`Text` comes from the ambient declaration in `lib.dom.d.ts`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13781/46564418-fa628400-c8bb-11e8-896a-d3de0e59fcfc.png)

If youâ€™re seeing a type error, something might be misconfigured in your tsconfig file (for example, the `dom` lib might not be included).

React is missing `DocumentFragment` internally but it is allowed at runtime: 
- https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/v16.9.0/packages/react-dom/src/client/ReactDOM.js#L452-L457
- https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/v17.0.2/packages/react-dom/src/client/ReactDOMRoot.js#L203-L207
